questions.description:
The displacement (x) of a particle depends on time t as 
x = at² – bt³	
Choose the incorrect statement from the following -

options.description: The particle never returns to its starting point
The particle comes to rest after time 2α/3β
The initial velocity of the particle is zero
The initial acceleration of the particle is not zero

questions.description: A body is projected with a velocity of 98 ms¯¹. If acceleration due to gravity be 9.8 m/s², then

options.description: It will go upto the maximum height of 980 m after 10 seconds
It will go upto the height of 490 m in 5 seconds
It will come back to earth in 10 seconds
Its speed reduces to 49 ms¯¹ after 5 seconds

questions.description: Two particle are released from the same height at an interval of 1 s. How long after the first particle beigns to fall will the two particles be 10 m apart (g = 10 m/s²)
A juggler has 4 balls and he throws them one after the other to a height 20m when he has just thrown a ball upward than height of other three balls is -
A body is thrown vertically upwards with an initial velocity u reaches maximum height in 6 seconds. The ratio of distance travelled by the body in the first Second and seventh second is -

The average velocity of a body moving with uniform acceleration after travelling a distance of 3.06m is 0.34 ms¯¹. If the change in velocity of the body is 0.18 ms¯¹ during this time its uniform acceleration is -
A particle is thrown vertically upward. Its velocity at half of the height is 10 m/s. The maximum height attained by it (g = 10 m/s²) -
A balloon starts rising from the ground with an acceleration of 1.25 m/s². After 8s, a stone is released from the balloon. The  stone will – (taking g = 10 ms¯²) -

options.description: cover a distance of 40 m in reaching the ground
begin to move down after being released

questions.description: From a building two balls A and B are thrown with same speed such that A is thrown upwards and B downwards (both vertically). If vA and vB are their respectively velocities on reaching the ground then -

options.description: their velocities depend on their masses

questions.description: A man throws balls with the same speed vertically upwards one after the other at an interval of 2 seconds. What should be the speed of the throw so that more than two balls are in the sky at any time -(Given g = 9.8 m/s²)

If relation between displacement (x) and time (t) is, 
t = αx2 – βx,  (α,β are positive constant) then find out relation between acceleration (a) and velocity (v) -
For a particle moving along x-axis, acceleration is given as a = v. Find the average velocity from t = 0 to t = 1 -(Given at t = 0, x = 0 and v = 1)

Two trains take 3 sec. to cross each other and takes 2.5 s, if the speed of one train is increased by 50%. The time  taken by train to cross each other when both are moving in same direction at their original speeds is -

A boy is running on the plane road with velocity (v) with a long hollow tube is in his hand. The water is falling vertically downwards with velocity (u). At what angle to the vertical, he must incline the tube so that the water drops enters it without touching its side

Six particles situated at the corners of a regular haxagon of side (a) move at a constant speed (v). Each particle maintains a direction towards the particle at the next corner. The time taken by the particles to meet each other is
Find out average speed in the above question for given interval -
The position of an object moving along x-axis is given by x = a + bt² where a = 8.5m, b = 2.5 m/sec² and t is measured in second. Then -

options.description: average velocity between t = 2 sec and t = 4 sec is 15 m/s

questions.description: In uniform motion -

options.description: Distance cover in equal time interval are equal
Velocity is the same as the average velocity at all instants

questions.description: A ball is thrown vertically upwards with velocity of 20 m/s from top of multistorey building. The height of the point from where the ball is thrown is 25 m from the ground, then -

options.description: Maximum height of the ball from ground is 45 m.
Time taken by ball to strike the ground is 5 sec.
Speed by which it will strike the ground is 30 m/s.

questions.description: According to Gallieo’s law of odd numbers, the ratio of distance traversed, during equal intervals of time, by a body falling from rest is -

In which of the following examples of motion, can the body be considered approximately a point object -
(a) a railway carriage moving without jerks between two stations.
(b) a monkey sitting on top of a man cycling smoothly on a circular track.
(c) a spinning cricket ball that turns sharply on hitting the ground.
(d) a tumbling beaker that has slipped off the edge of a table.

A jet airplane travelling at the speed of 500 km/h ejects its product of combustion at the speed of 1500 km/h relative to the jet plane. What is the speed of the latter with respect to an observer on the ground -

A car moving along a straight highway with speed of 126 km/h is brought to a stop with in distance of 200 m. Assume retardation of the car is constant, then -
(a) Retardation of the car is 3.06 m/sec².
(b) Time taken to stop the car is 11.4 sec.

Which of the following is/are correct for a particle in one-dimensional motion -
(a) with zero speed at an instant may have non-zero acceleration at that instant.
(b) with zero speed may have non-zero velocity.
(c) with constant speed must have zero acceleration.
(d) with positive value of acceleration must be speeding up.
The displacement of a particle is given by x = (t – 2)² where x is in metres and t in seconds. The distance covered by the particle in first 4 seconds is -

For an object falling through a fluid, its acceleration is given by a = g – bv where g = gravitational acceleration and b is constant. After a long time of release, it move with constant speed, then constant speed will be (v= velocity)
A ball is dropped from a building of sufficient height. Simultaneously another ball is thrown up with a speed 40 m/s. The relative speed of the balls will be (before any one strike the ground)
What is the period T of the bus service -
Speed of bus -

A police van moving on a highway with a speed of 30 km/h fires a bullet at a thief's car speeding away in the same direction with speed of 192 km/h. If the muzzle speed of bullet is 150 m/s with what speed does the bullet hit thief car -
